paper.title: Counterparty risk for CDS: Default clustering effects
paper.abstract: We derive a closed-form expression for the bilateral credit valuation adjustment of a credit default swap in presence of simultaneous defaults. We develop our analysis under a default intensity model specified by a class of three-dimensional subordinators, allowing for default dependence through common risk factors. We performance a suitable decomposition of the bilateral price into debit and credit valuation adjustment components. Those components do not have a symmetric impact on the price because of the joint event occurrences. Our analysis indicates that simultaneous defaults have material impact on the size and directionality of the adjustments. Our findings suggest policymakers to consider default clustering when designing counterparty valuation procedures, especially during periods of financial distress. (C) 2014 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究信用违约互换（CDS）的双边信用估值调整（CVA），特别是在同时违约情况下的影响。这直接涉及衍生品定价中的信用估值调整问题。同时，论文还讨论了违约聚类对调整大小和方向性的影响，这属于金融风险管理中的对手方风险管理范畴。
